issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: iOS: Ti.Calendar getEventsBetweenDates is not working

comments.body: Hi Sean, thnx for the workaround. I use a module for now but this needs to be fixed.
This is still an issue. Could we get a fix in place for this?

Has there been any updates in regards to the spelling issue here? This bug is of low priority, but it forces developers to make the fix themselves when they update Titanium/add new developers to their project. Thanks!

+1 We encountered this last year, and it still is a very serious pain that we need to modify the file in the titanium library folder every time we want to use a new build of the platform.

What is the time frame for this fix? It seems to be a simple mispelling as @Melissa said above.
[~ndustri] [~rborn] Can you validate that the PR is working for your use cases as well? I need to setup some demo dates first to finish CR and FT on this ticket. Thanks guys!

Verified as fixed.

Tested On:

iPhone 6S (9.3.3) Device 
Mac OSX El Capitan 10.11.6
Ti SDK: 5.4.0.v20160804185318
Appc Studio: 4.7.0.201607250649
Appc NPM: 4.2.7	
App CLI: 5.4.0-40
Xcode 7.3.1
Node v4.4.7

*Closing ticket.*
